title: Executive Order 7318-Authorizing the Appointment of Louis Hunter Gwinn to the Position of Customs Agent Without Regard to Civil Service Rules
content: By virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me by the provisions of paragraph Eighth of subdivision SECOND of section 2 of the Civil Service Act of January 16, 1883 (22 Stat. 403, 404), it is hereby ordered that Louis Hunter Gwinn may be appointed a Customs Agent in the Customs Service of the Treasury Department without compliance with the requirements of the Civil Service Rules.
This order is recommended by the Secretary of the Treasury, who states that Mr. Gwinn's appointment as a Customs Agent will be in the interest of the service.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 7318-Authorizing the Appointment of Louis Hunter Gwinn to the Position of Customs Agent Without Regard to Civil Service Rules Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/355677
